title: Google\Cloud\Logging\LoggingClient
name: LoggingClient
description:
Google Stackdriver Logging allows you to store, search, analyze, monitor, and alert on log data and events from Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services. Find more information at the Google Stackdriver Logging docs.

This client supports transport over REST or gRPC.

In order to enable gRPC support please make sure to install and enable the gRPC extension through PECL:

$ pecl install grpc

NOTE: Support for gRPC is currently at an Alpha quality level, meaning it is still a work in progress and is more likely to get backwards-incompatible updates.

When using gRPC in production environments, it is highly recommended that you make use of the Protobuf PHP extension for improved performance. Protobuf can be installed via PECL.

$ pecl install protobuf

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the log to write entries to.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.apiEndpoint
params.description: A hostname with optional port to use in place of the service's default endpoint.

params.name: options.messageKey
params.description: The key in the jsonPayload used to contain the logged message. Defaults to message.

params.name: options.resource
params.description: The monitored resource to associate log entries with. Defaults to type global.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: A set of user-defined (key, value) data that provides additional information about the log entry.

params.name: options.metadataProvider
params.description: Defaults to An automatically chosen provider, based on detected environment settings.

params.name: options.debugOutput
params.description: Whether or not to output debug information. Please note debug output currently only applies in CLI based applications. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.batchOptions
params.description: A set of options for a BatchJob. Google\Cloud\Core\Batch\BatchJob::__construct() for more details. Defaults to ['batchSize' => 1000, 'callPeriod' => 2.0, 'numWorkers' => 2].

params.name: options.clientConfig
params.description: Configuration options for the Logging client used to handle processing of batch items. For valid options please see Google\Cloud\Logging\LoggingClient::__construct().

params.name: options.batchRunner
params.description: A BatchRunner object. Mainly used for the tests to inject a mock. Defaults to a newly created BatchRunner.

params.name: options.closureSerializer
params.description: An implementation responsible for serializing closures used in the $clientConfig. This is especially important when using the batch daemon. Defaults to Google\Cloud\Core\Batch\OpisClosureSerializer if the opis/closure library is installed.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.credentialsFetcher
params.description: A credentials fetcher instance.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.requestTimeout
params.description: Seconds to wait before timing out the request. Defaults to 0 with REST and 60 with gRPC.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.quotaProject
params.description: Specifies a user project to bill for access charges associated with the request.

params.name: config.transport
params.description: The transport type used for requests. May be either grpc or rest. Defaults to grpc if gRPC support is detected on the system.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the sink.

params.name: destination
params.description: The export destination. Please see Exporting Logs With Sinks for more information and examples.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.filter
params.description: An advanced logs filter.

params.name: options.outputVersionFormat
params.description: The log entry version to use for this sink's exported log entries. This version does not have to correspond to the version of the log entry when it was written to Stackdriver Logging. May be either V1 or V2. Defaults to V2.

methods.name: sink
methods.description: Lazily instantiates a sink. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a sink please see Google\Cloud\Logging\Sink.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the sink.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the metric.

params.name: filter
params.description: An advanced logs filter.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.description
params.description: A description of the metric.

methods.name: metric
methods.description: Lazily instantiates a metric. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a metric please see Google\Cloud\Logging\Metric.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the metric.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

examples.caption: Use an advanced logs filter to fetch only entries from a specified log.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.projectIds
params.description: A list of projectIds to fetch entries from in addition to entries found in the project bound to this client.

params.name: options.resourceNames
params.description: One or more cloud resources from which to retrieve log entries. Projects listed in projectIds are added to this list. Example: "projects/my-project-1A", "projects/1234567890".

params.name: options.filter
params.description: An advanced logs filter.

params.name: options.orderBy
params.description: How the results should be sorted. Presently, the only permitted values are timestamp asc and timestamp desc. Defaults to "timestamp asc".

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

methods.name: psrLogger
methods.description: Fetches a logger which will write log entries to Stackdriver Logging and implements the PSR-3 specification.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the log to write entries to.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.messageKey
params.description: The key in the jsonPayload used to contain the logged message. Defaults to message.

params.name: options.resource
params.description: The monitored resource to associate log entries with. Defaults to type global.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: A set of user-defined (key, value) data that provides additional information about the log entry.

params.name: options.metadataProvider
params.description: Defaults to An automatically chosen provider, based on detected environment settings.

params.name: options.batchEnabled
params.description: Determines whether or not to use background batching. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.debugOutput
params.description: Whether or not to output debug information. Please note debug output currently only applies in CLI based applications. Defaults to false. Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true.

params.name: options.debugOutputResource
params.description: A resource to output debug output to. Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true.

params.name: options.batchOptions
params.description: A set of options for a BatchJob. Google\Cloud\Core\Batch\BatchJob::__construct() for more details. Defaults to ['batchSize' => 1000, 'callPeriod' => 2.0, 'numWorkers' => 2]. Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true. Note that this option is currently considered experimental and is subject to change.

params.name: options.clientConfig
params.description: Configuration options for the Logging client used to handle processing of batch items. For valid options please see Google\Cloud\Logging\LoggingClient::__construct(). Defaults to the options provided to the current client. Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true.

params.name: options.batchRunner
params.description: A BatchRunner object. Mainly used for the tests to inject a mock. Defaults to a newly created BatchRunner. Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true.

params.name: options.closureSerializer
params.description: An implementation responsible for serializing closures used in the $clientConfig. This is especially important when using the batch daemon. Defaults to Google\Cloud\Core\Batch\OpisClosureSerializer if the opis/closure library is installed.

methods.name: logger
methods.description: Fetches a logger which will write log entries to Stackdriver Logging.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the log to write entries to.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.resource
params.description: The monitored resource to associate log entries with. Defaults to type global.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: A set of user-defined (key, value) data that provides additional information about the log entry.
